info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 4 at 6:29PM CDT until April 8 at 2:00AM CDT by NWS Nashville TN
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Tennessee...
Duck River Near Hurricane Mills affecting Humphreys County.
For the Duck River...including Manchester, Shelbyville, Pottsville, Milltown, Columbia, Centerville, Hurricane Mills...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Duck River near Hurricane Mills.
* WHEN...Until early Tuesday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, Portions of Tumbling Creek Road east of Highway 13 are flooded to a depth of 2 feet and may be impassable.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 PM CDT Friday the stage was 20.3 feet and rising. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:00 PM CDT Friday was 21.8 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 20.4 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage this evening to 15.2 feet tomorrow evening. It will rise above flood stage late Sunday morning to 23.0 feet early Monday morning. It will then fall below flood stage again Monday evening. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued Saturday afternoon at 1230 PM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TUESDAY MORNING
